> I don't understand how they make assassins that are great tanks, and terrible kiteable tanks

Because they consider standard assassins that scale on kills to be "feast or famine" and therefore toxic, when it has always been better for assassins to be all about doing buttloads of damage in different ways.

As such, in an attempt to "create a balanced assassin," they give them cc and other things to make them less focused on assassination, which beats the whole point.

Favoritism! Kassadin was gutted initially because he was uncatchable & inescapable, yet riot hasn't done anything significant to ekko.
Though more likely due to greed, apparently tanks aren't as exciting to watch as telefragging assassins; even though tanks tend to have more counterplay.

Eh, tbh, Kassadin on his peek was broken af, more so than Ekko. Low CD flash, point-and-click silence and huge burst, there was no way to fight back, you were dead before silence ended. Similar shit to what LB and Talon were doing, just that Talon has no escape and LB falls off late game. Kassadin scales to late game and has amazing escape. Btw, Kassadin also had tanky build in his history, the infamous IBG build.

After his silence they halved the range on his ultimate without compensation. Ekko's getting compensated each time they nerf him. 
http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-68-notes#patch-ekko
Lowered base damage but noticeably increased the ratios, both on his shield execute & blink attack. 
http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-611-notes#patch-ekko
Did the exact same thing on his boomerang & ultimate. 
These changes collectively could have worked, if they were more drastic; like cutting the bases in half (while nudging his ratios a bit higher) so he has to buy offensive items to deal substantial damage.

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-44-notes#patch-kassadin
Not only did they remove his silence, but dropped the base damage by 1/4 without a buff; the shield only blocks magic damage and lasts for just over 1 second. Guess what's the most prevalent damage? Physical, in short making it worthless in most cases.
http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-54-notes#patch-kassadin
They cut the range of his blink by 1/3 but only the mana cost by 1/8. 
Kassadin's reign of tanky telefragging didn't last several patches either.

The obvious unwillingness to gut ekko in the same fashion when he has the same problems is blatant favoritism. Maybe it's because he's one of the few black champions, maybe it's because he's one of the few teenager champions, maybe it's because riot is being puppeted by another company for the past few years. I don't really care the reason, but they won't learn from their mistakes until they're willing to admit it. They won't change anything until they do.

It seems, that assassin Ekko works fine atm. His ult is easy to avoid since you see the shadow of ekko running behind him, so it is highly telegraphed where he will be if he uses his ult. His stun has a long travel time and so is kinda hard to aim properly. 

The only problem with Ekko is, that he gets played as a tank alot the last time, which is absolutely not intended and Riot is trying to remove that. That is the reason why Ekko got compensated for the nerfs in the past, because they still want him to do alot of damage like intended as a assassin, but to do so he should be forced to build damage. Lower base stats and better ratio is the answer for that.

I don't know how it was for Kassadin that time, but I guess Kassadin just worked too good in his original role -> assasin. So he got nerfed without compensation.

However Ekko has been flatout overloaded since release.

His passive is a slow & a speed bonus ontop of extra damage 3rd strike; roughly being a combination of gnar, braum, & vayne's passives in one.
The Q is a slowing boomerang that applies 2 stacks of his passive with a deceptively large hitbox, a better version of sivir's ability.
His W is an AOE 40% slow, that's also a 1.75 second stun, and a massive shield for him at rank 1; delayed sure, but it's invisible to the enemy until right before it lands and still stuns even if he's intangible or dead! This also gives him a massive bonus execute just for existing, and the bonus missing health damage applies to all of his attacks. 
Then there's his E, a dash that can cross most walls with an unavoidable blink due to being programmed as an instantaneous auto-attack, which applies both spell & auto effects (crystal scepter & lich bane, including his own passive). Think a cross between fizz & talon's gap closers, but can be used in most any direction he wants.
Finally there's his ultimate, a splice of a self soraka heal & ziggs ultimate that also makes him invincible while having no cast time.

So to sum up; he's got more crowd control than most immobile tanks, more combo potential than most mages, more mobility than the classic assassins, more damage than the common fighter, and more denial capacity than most supports. A good ekko player is inescapable & uncatchable thanks to; his 3 slows (2 of which are ranged aoe), a double gap closer that can be used on champions monsters & minions, a significant self-healing & self displacement ultimate that also punishes anyone trying to fight him (least being wasting time, most being wasting summoner spells & ultimates).

An assassin's job is to kill the enemy marksmen or mage, not both nor remotely close to the entire team. Yet the snowballing enforcement riot has placed as made the most damaging champions scale up faster & harder than anyone else.
Bruisers were considered a poor design choice originally because they had the damage of fighters & durability of tanks; and now days they've replaced actual tanks. I'm not surprised this assassin\fighter combination has become the most abused and most viable combination for similar reasons; they have the most mobility bar none, more damage than fighters, at least one debilitating crowd control like bruisers, and get to survive more damage than tanks thanks to excessive safety options. 
I'm for hybrid champions because they get to be flexible; but I'm against champions getting to benefit from too much, to the point their generalistic power is significantly better, than any specialized champion they're capable of replacing. That's the point of a generalist, to be mediocre at everything but good at nothing.

Ekko's slow is one of the main things that makes tank ekko the dominant build. He has some similar problems that original skarner's permaslow had. (full control of fights, makes it easy to win when ahead and almost always avoid death when not killing).

Another possibility is to just remove Ekko

Honestly i never fully understood why a slow there was necessary. I mean i get why Riot can' t make him go full Bolt so it has to share the power, but adding a slow while he has already one on an assassin on a bursting skill seems odd.

There's something to be said when a champion's most valuable stat is simply _staying alive_.

You want to kill someone? Go tank and abuse base damages.
You don't want to die? Go tank and abuse R + GA.
You want to stick to a target? Go tank and abuse spammable innate CC.
You want to do all these things and not be a tank? Go full AP, two-shot people, and still be unkillable because of R.


Nothing about Ekko is fun to play against. Nothing about Ekko feels fair. The fact that he can, at any point, just **_press R_** and **_completely undo all the work that you just did_** is _**infuriating**_.

You can wait out a Zilean ult.
You can wait out a Kayle ult.
You can wait out a Tyndamere ult.
You can wait out or disengage from a Taric ult.
You can wait out and run from a Yorick ghost.
You can run from a dead Sion.
You can run from a dead Karthus.

You CANNOT outplay an Ekko that presses R, he'll probably even kill you with it because it deals shit tons of damage on top of giving him a "get out of jail free card".


In short, you folks capitalized on Ekko's "theme" perfectly, you've made a champion that _**always succeeds**_ because _**he can't make mistakes**_.

You can outplay a ekko that presses R because you know where he goes back.

Also you can outplay an ekko by forcing him to use R at not full effect, like any other spell on this game, and don' t burst everything on him at the first occasion. You even know when his ult is up, differently from almost every other champion in the game.

If it's tank Ekko, you need to slowly whittle him down (likely losing a lot of your health in the process), then he presses R and heals for a significant portion of effective health.

_You now have to deal with a high-damage tank with barely any health of your own._


If it's AP Ekko, you might be able to burst him down, but he's going to do just as much damage to you just as quickly, press R, and heal for an even LARGER portion of his lost health due to the AP scaling.

_You now have to deal with a healthy AP burst mage with barely any health of your own._


Knowing where he's going to go can help you avoid the high base damage on his ult, but it's also a large AoE and, even if you do avoid it with some escape tool, it doesn't change the fact that _**you have to effectively kill Ekko twice**_ (maybe 3 times if he has GA).

Like I said, the problem is that _**he's still alive**_.

Ekko is worse in that respect.

but if you had a frozen mallet or a good Ms boost of your own, skarner was also locked into fighting you.

We're thinking about doing just that: lower slows, more of other things.

I'd say Ekko is already fairly Skirmisher-like in his damage output, mainly due to his passive, and I completely agree that his passive would need adjustments if it ever were to lose its cooldown (that, or he'd have to lose damage elsewhere, e.g. on his W passive).

You do have a point, though: making Ekko more dependent on continuous damage could further encourage tanky builds in order to preserve his stickiness. On the flipside, incentivizing Ekko to stick to his target for more damage, in spite of less continuous mobility, could make him put himself at greater risk overall, and with the right scaling (80% AP is already pretty steep) he'd have to force himself into squishier builds to be fully effective. It could also open up alternative itemization options, e.g. Nashor's Tooth, that would allow him to access cooldown reduction without dipping into overly tanky items (Spirit Visage is one of his most frequently picked items right now, for example).
